title: I get abuse and threats online - why can't it be stopped?
description: Online abuse against women is on the rise, but why aren't the police, government and social media sites doing more to stop it?

title: Has Covid changed New York City nightlife forever?
description: A photographer is confronted with the new reality of empty streets and closed clubs.

title: Songhaï: A 'zero waste' agricultural system to increase food security in Africa
description: Fr Godfrey Nzamujo runs a "zero waste" agriculture system aimed at increasing food security and creating jobs.

title: The climate activists who want Norway to end oil and gas production
description: The BBC's Nick Beake meets the young climate activists trying to stop Norway drilling for oil and gas.

title: Nebra Sky Disc: British Museum to display world's 'oldest map of stars'
description: The Nebra Sky Disc is dated 3,600-years-old and considered one of the most important archaeological finds.

title: The nightmare of India's tallest rubbish mountain
description: India's oldest and tallest mountain of rubbish in the city of Mumbai is 18 storeys high.

title: Covid: Thousands of children left without parents in Iran
description: Thousands of children in Iran have been left without parents, and many people blame the leadership.

title: You may be able to book a flying taxi within three years
description: Firms are racing to bring flying taxis and the mini-airports they need into service.

title: BBC's Rainsford can return if Russian journalists get UK visas - ambassador
description: Ambassador Andrei Kelin says the BBC reporter can return if Russian journalists gets UK visas.

title: Sir David Amess: Prevent scheme needs urgent work, says Robert Buckland
description: The strategy aimed at stopping people becoming terrorists needs improving, Robert Buckland says.

title: Fespaco: Pomp and colour as Africa’s biggest film festival starts
description: The Fespaco festival draws film fans from across the world to Burkina Faso.

title: A waxwork Queen and Squid Game manicure - stories you may have missed
description: A Squid Game manicure, Harry Potter wand classes, a fountain covered in nails, and the latest waxwork of the Queen.

title: Sir David Amess: MP murder suspect held under Terrorism Act
description: The man arrested over the killing of Sir David Amess is named as Ali Harbi Ali, a Briton of Somali heritage.

title: Westfield Stratford closed after fire in first floor shop
description: The complex in east London is evacuated after the discovery of a small fire in a first-floor shop.

title: David Amess death: Priti Patel says MPs must be safe and accessible
description: The death of David Amess has raised questions about the contact between MPs and their constituents.

title: Salisbury Plain soldier death: Jethro Watson-Pickering named by Army
description: Pte Jethro Watson-Pickering, 23, was part of a crew operating an Army vehicle at Salisbury Plain.

title: Breast cancer: 'Many men are oblivious they can get breast cancer'
description: Pat and Mark James both survived breast cancer, and want to warn "macho" men they could get it too.

title: Sir David Amess: Southend city bid would be a 'fitting tribute' to stabbed MP
description: Home Secretary Priti Patel called him Mr Southend and said his passion for the town warmed hearts.

title: Rory McIlroy: Northern Irishman storms into CJ Cup contention after superb 62
description: Rory McIlroy fires a 10-under-par 62 to move within two shots of leader Rickie Fowler after three rounds of the CJ Cup in Las Vegas.

title: Macron condemns 'unforgivable' 1961 massacre of Algerians in Paris
description: The 1961 Paris massacre was denied or concealed by French governments for decades.

title: Bruce has been the Newcastle 'fall guy', says son Alex
description: Steve Bruce has been the "fall guy" at Newcastle and it has been "really tough to watch" the criticism directed at him, says his son Alex Bruce.

title: Southeastern train services taken over by government
description: The rail operator was stripped of its franchise for failing to declare millions in taxpayer funding.

title: Haiti: US Christian missionaries kidnapped in Port-au-Prince - reports
description: At least 15 women, men and children were abducted by an armed gang near the capital, sources say.

title: Candlelit vigil in honour of MP
description: Hundreds of people carrying lanterns and candles gathered in Leigh-on-Sea to pay their respects.

title: Sudan: Protesters demand military coup as crisis deepens
description: The protests come as tensions rise between civilian and military rulers.

title: Britain's Norrie reaches Indian Wells final with win over Dimitrov
description: Britain's Cameron Norrie reaches his first Masters 1,000 final at Indian Wells as he beats Bulgarian Grigor Dimitrov in straight sets.

title: The Papers: 'Terror will not win' and MP murder suspect named
description: Sunday's front pages are dominated by reaction to the killing of Conservative MP Sir David Amess.

title: Venezuelan President Maduro's close aide extradited to US
description: Venezuela halted talks with the opposition after Alex Saab was flown from Cape Verde to the US.
